title: Islamabad’s 50% population vaccinated: Asad Umar
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 3 (APP): Minister for Planning, Development and Special Initiatives Asad Umar Tuesday said Islamabad had become the first city in Pakistan with a population of one million or more to get 50% of its eligible population vaccinated with at least one dose.
Islamabad has become the first city in Pak with a population of 1 million or more to get 50% of its eligible population vaccinated with at least one dose. Peshawar and pindi  35%, faislabad 28%, lahore/gujranwala /sialkot/sargodha 27%, karachi 26%, hyderabad 25%.
— Asad Umar (@Asad_Umar) August 3, 2021
In a tweet, he said the ratio in Peshawar and Rawalpindi is 35%, Faislabad 28%, Lahore, Gujranwala, Sialkot, Sargodha 27%, Karachi 26%, and Hyderabad 25%.
Meanwhile in another tweet, Asad Umar said the target set for one million vaccinations in a day was crossed yesterday (Monday) with 1.072 million vaccinations across the country.
